Title.evidence: Perioperative Aspirin in Vascular Surgery: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: POISE-2 was a blinded, randomised controlled trial

Intervention.evidence: patients assigned to aspirin or placebo

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was a composite of death or myocardial infarction at 30 days.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Patients, clinicians, and outcome assessors were blinded.

Number_Randomised.evidence: The study included 603 vascular surgery patients, with 319 in the continuation and 284 in the initiation stratum.

Result_Outcome.evidence: the primary outcome occurred in 13.7% with aspirin and 9.0% with placebo (HR 1.48, 95% CI 0.71 to 3.09)

Harms.evidence: Bleeding rates were similar between groups.

Funding.evidence: The study was funded by [source of funding not provided in the abstract].
